result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mason D Dorn was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2015 or penalty of 24 day Huber for non-payment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
Huber with standard release conditions.  Huber may be served in Outagamie County or another county contiguous to his employment.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

scanned and destroyed
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Traffic Safety School Report
from employer

Defendant Mason D Dorn in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.  Count 3 dismissed and read in.  Case 14TR7645 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following: 
- 40 days Huber with standard release conditions to commence on July 20, 2015 by 8:00pm.  Huber may be served in Outagamie County or another county contiguous to his employment.
- 15 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 15 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Fine totaling: $1,179.00 to be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2015; alternate 24 days Huber
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
